DOC.brief_summary: Ten ( 10 ) adult female subject caesarean surgery performed.Study conduct 1 site . Each subject receive three treatment one area randomly choose . The area leave untreated serve control . The objective Evaluate clinical impact UltraPulse fractional carbon dioxide laser treatment appearance Caesarean Scar ( CS ) compare similar untreated scar side .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Females good general health old 22 year age young 55 year age . 2 . Presenting caesarean scar mature stable caesarean scar ( least 1 year post procedure ) . 3 . At least six month follow termination breast feeding . 4 . Willing give sign inform consent form photographic release form . 5 . Willing comply study dose complete entire course study . 6 . Performed negative pregnancy test . 1 . Active bacterial , fungal , viral infection treatment area . 2 . Active cold sore , herpes treatment area . 3 . Recent excessive exposure sunlight artificial UV light ( e.g . : use tan beds/booths and/or sunbathe ) expectation tan time study . 4 . History presence skin condition/disease might interfere diagnosis evaluation study parameter ( i.e. , atopic dermatitis , eczema , psoriasis ) . 5 . Treatment systemic retinoid within past year ( e.g. , AccutaneÂ® , Roche Dermatologics ) . 6 . History present keloid scar . 7 . Any current recent treatment cancer . 8 . Any uncontrolled systemic disease . A potential subject therapy systemic disease yet stabilize consider entry study . 9 . Significant history current evidence medical , psychological disorder , investigator 's opinion , would preclude enrollment study . 10 . Previous laser treatment scar least 0.5 year prior evaluation . 11 . Subject plan cosmetic procedure study area study period , treatment perform investigator . 12 . Any condition may exclude patient treatment per physician discretion . 13 . Female subject pregnant , nurse infant .
